lines.text: There is no difference between the magic rhythms of Bill Shakespeare's immortal verse, and the magic rhythms of Bill Robinson's immortal feet.
That's an early Degas, isn't it?
[examines painting]

[playing up their age difference]
Yeah, I swiped it from his desk in school. Was he sore...
We're not fighting! We're in complete agreement! We hate each other!
I can stand anything but failure!
Rah, rah Tony! Rah, rah Tony! Tony! Hunter! Sis boom bah!
You got more scenery in this show than there is in Yellowstone National Park!
No, don't say it - "Tony Hunter! 1953!" I hereby declare my independence. Tony Hunter, 1776.
[narration during the Girl Hunt ballet]
She came at me in sections... more curves than a scenic railway.

[singing]
That's En-ter-tain-ment.
The show's a big hit, Tony... It's going to run for a long time.As far as I'm concerned, it's going to run forever.
She was bad. She was dangerous. I wouldn't trust her any farther than I could throw her. But... she was my kind of woman.
Joe - if my wife asks where I am, tell her that I've gone to Tahiti. To paint.
Oh, I'm afraid I've been very rude, I haven't told you how wonderful you were tonight.
Oh, thank you, I'm a great admirer of your work.
I didn't think you'd even heard of me.
Heard of you? I used to see all your pictures when I was a little girl. And I'm still a fan, I recently went to see a revival of them at the museum...

[offended]
Museum? 'Step right this way, ladies and gentlemen, Egyptian mummies, extinct reptiles, and Tony Hunter, the grand old man of the dance!"
I didn't mean...
Young lady, I'll have you know I can still thread a needle without my eyeglasses and still occasionally do a soft-shoe shuffle! Nothing balletic of course...
You're not a ballet devotee, are you?
Oh, yes! I saw all the greats - Pavlova, Carsanova, you don't see dancing like that nowadays. Oh, I'm terribly sorry...
Oh, that's all right! I wouldn't expect you to class me with Pavlova. In fact I doubt even she'd be good enough for you. You'd probably insist on an audition first!
Darn right, I'd audition my own grandmother.
Then why don't you audition mine? She'd be just about right for you! Oh, I'm sorry...
Oh, no you're not.
No I'm not!
Neither am I!
She was scared. Scared as a turkey in November.
I can stand anything but pain!

[pitching his idea for the show]
Exploiter of children! Purveyor of evil!
The city was asleep. The joints were closed. The rats and hoods and killers were in their holes.

[Doubtful]
This guy can direct a musical?

[Enthralled]
This guy can do anything!
Oh! Remember this guy?
Oh, Tony Hunter, the singing, dancing fellow.
Yeah, he was good 12, 15 years ago, but he's washed up.
You know, the funy thing about what you're saying is that it's absolutely true.
Gee, there's a mob of reporters and photographers over there!
Yeah, there must be some big shot aboard. Maybe the president.
No, too many for that. Probably a movie star.
I should have listened to my mother. She told me only to be in hit shows.

You used the phrase 'he sells his soul to the Devil', now that's the line you have to carry straight through. Just like Faust, this man is tempted by the Devil and his compromise, his sell out, must end in eternal damnation
That'll leave 'em laughing!
